_header: Lo I chief princess Dame Sapience
Subjects: Henry VI, return to London, 1432; pageant verses; chronicles, verse in; occasional verse
_description: Pageant verses by Sapience at the return of Henry VI to London, A.D. 1432, in Fabyan’s Chronicle, Part VII, Septima Pars, Henrici Sexti — one stanza rhyme royal

HarEng766.Transcription:
Loo I chief pryncesse Dame SapienceShew vnto you this Sentence of
                    ScriptureKynges that been moost of Excellenceffor throuth my help and
                    my besy CureTo encrease their glory and their high renowneThey shall
                    of wysdam haue full possessioun
